en: Every wise woman buildeth her house; But the foolish plucketh it down with her own hands.
hmr: Nuhmei var taphawt chun a in chu a bâwl a, Nuhmei invêt ruok chun a kuthaiin a ṭhiek hlak.

en: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth Jehovah; But he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
hmr: Mi, felnaa fe chun LALPA chu a ṭih a, A lampuihaia khêlinhlip ruok chun ama a hmusit hlak.

en: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod for his pride; But the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
hmr: Mi invêt baua chun chapona hmawl a um a, Mi var hmûrhai ruok chun hla lem a tih.

en: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean; But much increase is by the strength of the ox.
hmr: Bâwngchalhai um nawnaa chun ran in chu a fai a, Amiruokchu, hlâwkna nasatak chu bâwngchal hrâtna lei a nih.

en: A faithful witness will not lie; But a false witness uttereth lies.
hmr: Thuhretu ringum chu inkhêl naw nih a, Thuhretu indik naw ruok chun khêl hril a tih.

en: A scoffer seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not; But knowledge is easy unto him that hath understanding.
hmr: Hmusittu chun varna a zawng hlak a, a hmu ngai nawh, Hrietthiemna neitu ta ding ruok chun thiemna chu a awlsam hlak.

en: Go into the presence of a foolish man, And thou shalt not perceive in him the lips of knowledge.
hmr: Mi invêt hmaihmaa inthawk chun fe hmang rawh, Amaa inthawk chun thiemna hmûrhai hmu chuong naw ti nih.

en: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way; But the folly of fools is deceit.
hmr: Mi var varna chu a lampui hrietthiem chu a na, Mi invêt invêtna ruok chu khêlthu chu a nih.

en: A trespass-offering mocketh fools; But among the upright there is good will.
hmr: Mi suol chun suolna chu an nuisan a, Mi tluonghai laia ruok chun Pathien ditsakna chu a um.

en: The heart knoweth its own bitterness; And a stranger doth not intermeddle with its joy.
hmr: Lungril chun ama khâkna tak chu a hriet a, Hmêlmak mi chun an hlimna chu a sukbuoi ngai nawh.

en: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown; But the tent of the upright shall flourish.
hmr: Mi khawhlo in chu nam thlûk nîng a ta, Mi tluong puon in ruok chu um rân a tih.

en: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man; But the end thereof are the ways of death.
hmr: Mihriem kuoma indik âwmtak- a inlang lampui chu a um a, Chu tâwpna ruok chu thina lampuihai a nih.

en: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; And the end of mirth is heaviness.
hmr: Innuinaa ngei khawm lungril chu a lungngai a, Chu hlimna tâwpna chu chungrikna a nih.

en: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways; And a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
hmr: Lungrila hnungtawltu chu ama lampuihai ngeia suksip nîng a ta, Chun, mi ṭha chu amaa inthawk ngei chun suktlai nîng a tih.

en: The simple believeth every word; But the prudent man looketh well to his going.
hmr: Mi mâwl chun thu tinrêng el hi a ring a, Mi var ruok chun a fena chu a en ngun hlak.

en: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil; But the fool beareth himself insolently, and is confident.
hmr: Mi var chun suol chu a ṭih a, a fe hmangsan hlak a, Mi invêt ruok chun chaponain a hmang a, ama ân ring tlat hlak.

en: He that is soon angry will deal foolishly; And a man of wicked devices is hated.
hmr: Lunginsen awltak chun invêttakin thaw rawp a ta, Chun, mi remruotna khawhlo neitu chu theida ni bawk a tih.

en: The simple inherit folly; But the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
hmr: Mi mâwl chun invêtna ro chu a hluo a, Mi varhai ruok chu thiemna inkhumtirin an um.

en: The evil bow down before the good; And the wicked, at the gates of the righteous.
hmr: Mi suol chu mi ṭha hmaa chun a kûn a, Mi khawhlo chu mi fel daikawtkhârhaia chun a kûn bawk a.

en: The poor is hated even of his own neighbor; But the rich hath many friends.
hmr: Mi pasie chu a tuolbâwmhai ngei khawma theida a ni hlak a, Mi hausa ruok chun ruolhai tamtak a nei.

en: He that despiseth his neighbor sinneth; But he that hath pity on the poor, happy is he.
hmr: A tuolbâwm hmusittu chun a suksuol a na, Mi pasie chunga lunginsietna nei ruok chu a hlim a nih.

en: Do they not err that devise evil? But mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
hmr: Thil ṭha naw rawt suoktuhai chun an suksuol a ni naw am a nih? Thil ṭha rawt suoktuhai kuoma ruok chun thutak le lunginsietna um a tih.

en: In all labor there is profit; But the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
hmr: Sininrimna po poa hin hlâwkna a um a, Hmûrhaia a hrila hril ngawt el hi chu tlâksamnaah ân nghat.

en: The crown of the wise is their riches; But the folly of fools is only folly.
hmr: An hausaknahai chu mi var ta ding chun an lallukhum a na, Invêthai invêtna ruok chu invêtna ringawt el a nih.

en: A true witness delivereth souls; But he that uttereth lies causeth deceit.
hmr: Thuhretu indik chun mihai a sansuok hlak a, Thukhêl sâksuoktu ruok chun inhlêmna ân umtir.

en: In the fear of Jehovah is strong confidence; And his children shall have a place of refuge.
hmr: LALPA ṭinaa hin ringna nghettak a um a, A thlahai chun inhumhimna hmun nei an tih.

en: The fear of Jehovah is a fountain of life, That one may depart from the snares of death.
hmr: LALPA ṭina chu hringna tuikhur a na, Thina chânghaia inthawka pêt hmangna leh.

en: In the multitude of people is the king’s glory; But in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
hmr: Mipuihai pungkhâwmnaa chun lal ropuina chu a um a, Mipui tlâksamnaa ruok chun lal nau sietna chu a um thung.

en: He that is slow to anger is of great understanding; But he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
hmr: Mi lunginsen intaktak chu hrietthiemna nasatak nei a nih, Lungril ṭuonrang ruok chun invêtna chu a chawimawi a nih.

en: A tranquil heart is the life of the flesh; But envy is the rottenness of the bones.
hmr: Lungril hrisêl chu taksa hringna a na, Itthîkna ruok hi chu ruhai ta dinga hmawnna a nih.

en: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker; But he that hath mercy on the needy honoreth him.
hmr: Mi pasie nêksâwrtu chun ama Siemtu a hmusit a nih, Tlasam chunga lunginsietna nei ruok chun ama ân za a nih.

en: The wicked is thrust down in his evil-doing; But the righteous hath a refuge in his death.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu a thilthaw ri- loa chun sukthlûkin a um a, Mi fel ruok chun a thinaa chun beiseina a nei hlak.

en: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding; But that which is in the inward part of fools is made known.
hmr: Varna chu mi hrietthiemna neitu lungrila chun a chêng a, Invêthai lungrila um ruok chu ân hrietsa zing a nih.

en: Righteousness exalteth a nation; But sin is a reproach to any people.
hmr: Felna hin hnam a chawimawi a, Suolna ruok hi chu mi tukhawm ta dinga hmusitumna a nih.

en: The king’s favor is toward a servant that dealeth wisely; But his wrath will be against him that causeth shame.
hmr: Siehlaw vartaka thawtu chunga chun lal ditsakna chu a um a, Ama sukzaktu chunga ruok chun a lunginsenna um a tih.
